input: Design an automated retail support system that triages inquiries, resolves simple issues, routes complex ones to agents, and tracks resolution performance.

inputs.name: B
inputs.input_data: Textual/structured rules defining issue categories and resolution thresholds

inputs.name: R
inputs.input_data: Numeric thresholds for resolution quality (e.g., 90% accuracy)

inputs.name: A
inputs.input_data: Calendar data with agent working hours and skill sets

inputs.name: E
inputs.input_data: Structured rules for when/why to escalate issues

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Customer profiles, purchase history, support history
inputs.bound_reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

inputs.name: H
inputs.input_data: Past interaction records with resolution outcomes
inputs.bound_reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Real-time customer inquiry content and metadata
inputs.bound_reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

inputs.name: A
inputs.input_data: Historical agent performance scores and resolution times
inputs.bound_reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

inputs.name: K
inputs.bound_reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

steps:
Uses: Current Inquiry Data
Action: Ingest and preprocess customer inquiry content
Produces: Structured inquiry record
Stores/Sends To: Triage processing queue

Uses: Business Rules for Triage, Historical Resolution Data
Action: Apply ML classification model to determine issue complexity
Produces: Inquiry complexity score (low/medium/high)
Stores/Sends To: Resolution engine

Uses: Resolution Success Criteria, Knowledge Base Content
Action: Execute automated resolution workflow for low-complexity issues
Produces: Resolved issue response
Stores/Sends To: Customer communication channel

Uses: Escalation Protocols, Agent Availability Schedule, Agent Performance Metrics
Action: Calculate optimal agent assignment using weighted scoring
Produces: Agent assignment matrix
Stores/Sends To: Agent work queue

Uses: Customer Database, Agent Performance Metrics
Action: Monitor resolution progress and calculate KPIs (resolution time, success rate)
Produces: Performance dashboard metrics
Stores/Sends To: Analytics dashboard

Uses: Historical Resolution Data, Knowledge Base Content
Action: Apply NLP to identify knowledge gaps and update documentation
Produces: Updated knowledge base entries
Stores/Sends To: Documentation repository

[Note: All derivable inputs (complexity score, agent assignment, KPIs, etc.) have been decomposed into their terminal sources. All steps reference only declared inputs. All outputs are externally verifiable artifacts.]
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Business Rules for Triage
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Retail operations team
   Input Data: Textual/structured rules defining issue categories and resolution thresholds
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

2. Resolution Success Criteria
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Customer service leadership
   Input Data: Numeric thresholds for resolution quality (e.g., 90% accuracy)
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

3. Agent Availability Schedule
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: HR/workforce management system
   Input Data: Calendar data with agent working hours and skill sets
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

4. Escalation Protocols
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Customer service policy document
   Input Data: Structured rules for when/why to escalate issues
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

5. Customer Database
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: CRM system API endpoint
   Input Data: Customer profiles, purchase history, support history
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

6. Historical Resolution Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Support ticketing system database
   Input Data: Past interaction records with resolution outcomes
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

7. Current Inquiry Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Support channel APIs (chat/email/phone)
   Input Data: Real-time customer inquiry content and metadata
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

8. Agent Performance Metrics
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Workforce optimization system
   Input Data: Historical agent performance scores and resolution times
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

9. Knowledge Base Content
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Internal documentation repository
   Input Data: Structured troubleshooting guides and FAQs
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

Outputs:
1. Triage Results with Complexity Score
2. Routed Inquiries with Assignment Metadata
3. Resolved Issue Responses
4. Performance Dashboard with KPIs
5. Updated Knowledge Base Entries

Steps:
Step 1:
Uses: Current Inquiry Data
Action: Ingest and preprocess customer inquiry content
Produces: Structured inquiry record
Stores/Sends To: Triage processing queue

Step 2:
Uses: Business Rules for Triage, Historical Resolution Data
Action: Apply ML classification model to determine issue complexity
Produces: Inquiry complexity score (low/medium/high)
Stores/Sends To: Resolution engine

Step 3:
Uses: Resolution Success Criteria, Knowledge Base Content
Action: Execute automated resolution workflow for low-complexity issues
Produces: Resolved issue response
Stores/Sends To: Customer communication channel

Step 4:
Uses: Escalation Protocols, Agent Availability Schedule, Agent Performance Metrics
Action: Calculate optimal agent assignment using weighted scoring
Produces: Agent assignment matrix
Stores/Sends To: Agent work queue

Step 5:
Uses: Customer Database, Agent Performance Metrics
Action: Monitor resolution progress and calculate KPIs (resolution time, success rate)
Produces: Performance dashboard metrics
Stores/Sends To: Analytics dashboard

Step 6:
Uses: Historical Resolution Data, Knowledge Base Content
Action: Apply NLP to identify knowledge gaps and update documentation
Produces: Updated knowledge base entries
Stores/Sends To: Documentation repository

[Note: All derivable inputs (complexity score, agent assignment, KPIs, etc.) have been decomposed into their terminal sources. All steps reference only declared inputs. All outputs are externally verifiable artifacts.]

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
**Step 1:**  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** Combines "ingest" and "preprocess" actions, which involve sequencing. An AEB must have single intent and no internal steps.  
- **Suggest:** Split into two AEBs:  
  1. Ingest customer inquiry content  
  2. Preprocess customer inquiry content  

---

**Step 2:**  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** Single intent (apply ML classification model), interacts with one system (ML model API), no branching/sequencing.  
- **Suggest:** N/A  

---

**Step 3:**  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** "Execute automated resolution workflow" implies multiple internal steps (e.g., validation, branching logic, API calls), violating "no sequencing."  
- **Suggest:** Break into discrete actions (e.g., validate criteria, retrieve knowledge base content, execute resolution logic).  

---

**Step 4:**  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** Single intent (calculate agent assignment), can be implemented as a weighted scoring function with inputs as parameters.  
- **Suggest:** N/A  

---

**Step 5:**  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** "Monitor resolution progress" implies ongoing polling/sequencing over time, and "calculate KPIs" may bundle multiple metrics (resolution time vs. success rate).  
- **Suggest:** Split into:  
  1. Calculate resolution time KPI  
  2. Calculate success rate KPI  

---

**Step 6:**  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** Combines NLP analysis (knowledge gap identification) and documentation update, which are two distinct actions with separate intents.  
- **Suggest:** Split into:  
  1. Apply NLP to identify knowledge gaps  
  2. Update documentation repository with new entries  

--- 

**Summary of Non-AEB Fixes:**  
- Split multi-action steps (e.g., "ingest + preprocess," "workflow execution").  
- Separate monitoring/polling from metric calculation.  
- Isolate NLP analysis from documentation updates.  
- Ensure each step maps to a single API/function call with no internal logic.
